attributes.action: Allow grants to be given to students over 18 years old, who have completed at least two years further education.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Students in full time further education who have reached the age of 18 years old, are only allowed grants depending on family income.
While it is accepted that parent are responsible for the upkeep of their children, ( UNDER 18 YEARS OLD ).
Those students who have reached the legal age of adulthood, are denied any grants or benefits and the responsibility for their upkeep is again thrust upon the parents.
Those students who have left school and who have completed at least two years full time further education should be allowed a grant or weekly payment which is non repayable.
This would give them some form of dignity and a income, and would ease the burden of hard pressed parents who may have other children to contend with.
The grants would be for personal use in line with other state benefits, and not to pay student fees which is covered by other legislation.
